node.title: A Kennedy Center Honors With the Presidential Box Used as Intended
node.alt: In a sign that the Kennedy Center Honors were getting back to normal, President Biden attended with the first lady, Dr. Jill Biden, and Vice President Kamala Harris.
node.description: Former President Donald J. Trump did not attend the tribute, but President Biden was on hand as Bette Midler, Joni Mitchell, Berry Gordy, Justino DÃ­az and Lorne Michaels were honored.
node.content: ["WASHINGTON \u2014 The orchestra cycled through an early homage to the latest class of honorees: an excerpt from the opera \u201cCarmen,\u201d a tribute to the sounds of Motown, the chorus of \u201cWind Beneath My Wings.\u201d ", "But the 44th Kennedy Center Honors did not begin in earnest on Sunday night until President Biden and Dr. Jill Biden, the first lady, arrived to their seats in the presidential box in the opera house, and were introduced to a standing ovation from a crowd of thousands wearing masks and black tie.", "Mr. Biden\u2019s presence \u2014 the first time a president has attended the event since 2016 \u2014 heralded the restoration of tradition for the Honors, a star-studded event that recognizes lifetime achievements in the arts, including music, dance, theater, film and comedy, and helps raise money for the arts complex. The event had been rattled in recent years by former President Donald Trump\u2019s decision to skip the festivities altogether after some recipients had announced in 2017 that they would not attend a gala event at the White House. Then in 2020 it was derailed, or at least delayed, by the coronavirus pandemic.", "\u201cIt is quite nice \u2014 very nice \u2014 to see the presidential box once again being occupied,\u201d David Letterman, the comedian, declared in opening remarks, prompting a standing ovation from the crowd as Mr. Biden and Dr. Jill Biden waved. They were joined by Vice President Kamala Harris and Douglas Emhoff, the Second Gentleman.", "Just six months after an abbreviated celebration of the 2020 nominees, there were glimmers of both political and artistic normalcy. The show returned to its annual December slot, providing nearly four hours of tribute performances and speeches to more than 2,000 guests, who packed the opera house in shimmering gowns and tuxedos.", "And in addition to attending the event, Mr. Biden revived the practice of hosting a White House reception for the five honorees: Bette Midler, the screen and stage actress; Joni Mitchell, the singer-songwriter; Berry Gordy, the founder of Motown; the opera singer Justino Di\u0301az; and Lorne Michaels, the creator of \u201cSaturday Night Live.\u201d", "\u201cFor this pandemic of profound loss and pain, as we move forward toward repair and renewal, the artist vision is important as it ever has been \u2014 I would argue more important,\u201d Mr. Biden told the honorees in the East Room. \u201cWe\u2019ve seen the power of art in every form to heal, to comfort, and recover.\u201d", "He lavished praise on the honorees, calling Ms. Midler \u201ca performer without peer,\u201d and praising Mr. D\u00edaz for bestowing \u201cthe sound of soul\u201d on audiences. He thanked Mr. Gordy for helping to create \u201cmusic that lifted us higher\u201d and told Ms. Mitchell, \u201cYou sing poetry, it seems to me.\u201d", "And he called Mr. Michaels \u201cMr. Wise Guy,\u201d joking about the number of actors tapped to play the president on \u201cS.N.L.\u201d over the years, and noting, \u201cIf you can\u2019t laugh at yourself, we\u2019re in real trouble \u2014- and you make me laugh at myself a lot.\u201d", "Echoes of the pandemic still reverberated. Attendees had to repeatedly show proof of vaccination, an existing policy for all performances at the Kennedy Center. Masks \u2014 an array of medical, satin and sequined \u2014 were required, but removed for photos, performances and food.", "The medallion ceremony on Saturday evening, a traditionally more intimate dinner where the honorees receive the rainbow-ribboned awards, was held at the Library of Congress in order to host just over 200 people and accommodate coronavirus protocols.", "Seated at library desks with the lamps on, the honorees were feted under the gaze of statues of Shakespeare and Plato, after guests perused exhibits dedicated to their work. As he received his medallion, Mr. D\u00edaz, allured by the acoustics, burst into an excerpt from \u201cOtello,\u201d his deep voice reverberating throughout the room.", "Ms. Mitchell, who spoke briefly with reporters after receiving her medallion, said that \u201cthere was a lot of heart to the whole thing.\u201d", "The Honors event is a key fund-raiser for the Kennedy Center, which is celebrating the 50th anniversary of its opening in 1971. The event raised nearly $6.5 million, a spokeswoman said, with the cost of tickets to the Sunday gala ranging between $600 and $10,000.", "But for the honorees and the menagerie of lawmakers, donors, artists, colleagues and family members arriving to pay tribute, it was a celebration of not just their legacy, but of the return of their communities and live performances after the pandemic devastated arts industries around the world.", "\u201cIt\u2019s very special and it\u2019s a different perspective \u2014 I get to enjoy, not suffer with nerves,\u201d said Mr. D\u00edaz, who performed during the Kennedy Center\u2019s inaugural year in Ginastera\u2019s \u201cBeatrix Cenci\u201d (and who sang in the first performance at the new Metropolitan Opera House in Lincoln Center in 1966).\u201cIt\u2019s like coming home again, except a different part of the house.\u201d", "Members of the cast of \u201cAin\u2019t Too Proud: The Life and Times of The Temptations,\u201d the Broadway musical, sang a cappella on the red carpet in between interviews, before performing in character onstage as part of a tribute to Mr. Gordy. For Pete Buttigieg, the Transportation secretary, and his husband, Chasten, the evening was their first date night since their twins were born. And Speaker Nancy Pelosi of California and a host of bipartisan lawmakers could be seen applauding and dancing in their seats before the end of the night.", "\u201cI think I\u2019m in a dream,\u201d Mr. Gordy proclaimed. \u201cAnd it\u2019s a wonderful dream.\u201d", "To honor Ms. Mitchell, the ceremony included Brandi Carlile, a friend and collaborator, performing \u201cRiver,\u201d Ellie Goulding singing \u201cBig Yellow Taxi,\u201d and Norah Jones performing both \u201cThe Circle Game\u201d and \u201cA Case of You.\u201d", "Mr. D\u00edaz grew emotional as his daughters, Natascia D\u00edaz and Katya D\u00edaz, sang \u201cEn Mi Viejo San Juan,\u201d before excerpts from \u201cCarmen\u201d and \u201cFaust\u201d were performed. Ms. Midler cheered as a trio of her \u201cHello, Dolly\u201d castmates performed \u201cFriends,\u201d before Billy Porter, the actor and singer, emerged from a clam shell to lead a medley of her songs.", "A parade of comedic veterans from S.N.L. alternated between gently ribbing Mr. Michaels, their former \u2014 or current \u2014 \u00a0boss, and thanking him for his influence on their careers. It was punctuated by a trio of mock \u201cWeekend Update\u201d segments hosted by Kevin Nealon, Seth Meyers and Amy Poehler, and Colin Jost and Michael Che. Paul Simon concluded the tribute to Mr. Michaels with a performance of \u201cAmerica.\u201d", "During the tribute to Mr. Gordy, the show paused to restart after an apparent technical mishap. But when the set parted to reveal Stevie Wonder at the piano, breaking into a medley that included \u201cMy Cherie Amour,\u201d \u201cYou Are the Sunshine of My Life,\u201d and \u201cSuperstition,\u201d the crowd erupted into raucous applause.", "By the finale, \u201cHigher Ground,\u201d the audience was on its feet.", "\u201cTo be part of this sort of lineage and this long line of people who have contributed so much to the culture, it\u2019s just staggering to me,\u201d Ms. Midler said. \u201cI am so thrilled.\u201d", "The Kennedy Center Honors will be broadcast on CBS on Dec. 22."]
